channel.title: Forum suggestion
channel.description:
Well you see this a lot in tech forums for VB.
What I am suggesting is a mod to be added as such so where on server help/client help/general questions maybe you mark the topic as [unresolved] or [solved]
when it is in the [solved] tag it would automatically lock the topic. Only a moderator or the topic owner be able to change it back if the problem was perceived to be fixed but did not actually fix it.
The reason why I am suggesting this is I grow tired of seeing troll/flame comments on topic that have already been answered.
[hr]
Another item I would like to suggest is giving topic owners in the same sections power to delete user comments that are not needed. The reason for this is to help moderatoe your own topic without having to wait five plus hours for a moderator to come a long and give a "warning"
I feel that both of these suggestions are useful and could work out to be very good.

item.title: Forum suggestion
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

hmm I see the arguments here on both sides about locking/merging/not doing anything. I have a better solution.

This WILL require some maintence obviously but I feel over a course of time this could be good.

  1. Make a sticky with all the various revisions/bases.
  2. Like several tutorial stickies you list all the different topics in general. so for example " how to do this - 317 - PI " etc.
  3. IF the answer cannot be sent from the source or found in the source (the stickied thread) then the person’s [UNRESOLVED] thread will appear. Like…let’s say every month for instance a staff member could go and “update” this thread with the new entries.
  4. I still support that once the issue has been fixed that the topic is locked as it will be in the database/sticky thread then. (When you lock it, it could automatically make a link to the topic in the database/sticky thread? )
  5. The topic would go to [RESOLVED] status.

OR

  1. Somebody makes a database/sticky thread with a hell a lot of information like the other suggestion
  2. server help/general help/client help/general questions/whatever turns into more of a “ticket” system.
  3. upon completion of the help to the person the topic would be forwarded to the team handling the sticky thread/database to be added. The topic COULD stay opened for addendum etc.

But in all honesty, something DOES need to be done. The server help section is literally swamped with good and bad help questions. Some aren’t even related to the proper places and even with reports to moderators it never gets moved cause there are so many. Only way to start change is to contribute to it.

I would be, and I am sure there are several members of the community who would be glad to help with updating/keep up to date a vast database of some sorts.

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:427097”]I don’t think either of you can make those assumptions without knowing more about how the forums work.
